meanings.definition: To adjust the timing of something.
meanings.sent1: I had to retime the clock to make sure it was accurate.
meanings.sent2: She decided to retime her morning routine to be more efficient.
meanings.sent3: Trying to retime the sprinklers turned into a waterworks show in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The conductor had to retime the orchestra's performance to match the dancer's pace.
meanings.sent5: He had to retime his steps to the beat of the music.

meanings.sent1: After the mishap, they had to retime the experiment from the beginning.
meanings.sent2: The coach asked the runner to retime his sprint for accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to retime the baking of the cake due to a sudden power outage.
meanings.sent4: She had to retime her speech rehearsal after losing track of time.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to retime the test to allow for extra time for the students.
